page.title: 07Towers and New House Farms
page.content: The biggest farm in our area is {Towers Farm}covering some 250 acres. The current owner is Mr.Wainwright. He is a dairy farmer and has 60-70 cows on 250 acres. It is mostly pasture, though he also grows fodder beet. His cows are{Holsteins,}a Friesian breed, which are good milkers. Each cow's milk yield is 6,000 litres per year. When the cows are seven or eight years old they are sent off to be slaughtered. Mr.Wainwright's main markets are {Bakewell and Congleton.}He has two people working on the farm with him. {New House farm}covers 170 acres on which is grown Barley,hay and silage. Beef cattle are kept for fattening. Some cattle are kept in cubicle housing The farmer's land is covered with old Mine shafts and trackways which causes many problems.
